column4: hello i have just update aMSN. on ubuntu 8.04 and im getting this error: " Loading TkCximage failed. This module is need to run aMSN. Please compile aMSN first, instructions on how to compile are located in the file Install." can anyone help me??
sudo apt-get --purge remove amsn; sudo apt-get clean; sudo apt-get install amsn
unless you compiled it, in which case it will need recompiling differently
i have try the method you told me, but nothing changes. I get the same error again.
is there a ~/.amsn directory?
yes there is ~/.amsn directory. at home/username/.amsn/
rename that folder and rerun, see if it helps. rename it back if it doesnt work
same again. the same error.
ok delete the newly created ~/.ams folder and rename the old one back so you are where you started again
maybe theres a newer version released than is on your repos
check the amsn site
is the latest version, but i cannot still open it!
whats the error again?
Loading TkCximage failed. This module is need to run aMSN. Please compile aMSN first, instructions on how to compile are located in the file Install.
http://www.amsn-project.net/forums/viewtopic.php?t=4738
easier solution is to edit the first line of the 'amsn' script and change 'wish' by 'wish8.5' or 'wish8.4' depending on which version you are using.
but read the whole post
uninstall the ati driver
you'll need to boot to recovery root console to do this
: to apt-get remove xorg-driver-fglrx ?
if thats the package, yes
: i have try it already removing the package and then reconfigure. but when i restart ubuntu start in console mode and not gnome
then boot to console mode and run: less /var/log/Xorg.0.log
jongbergs : i have try reconfigure but same black screen. any othe idea?
